DBLP:conf/icwsm/PriniskiMHMLLB21.title: Mapping Moral Valence of Tweets Following The Killing of George Floyd
DBLP:conf/icwsm/PriniskiMHMLLB21.author:
J. Hunter Priniski and
Negar Mokhberian and
Bahareh Harandizadeh and
Fred Morstatter and
Kristina Lerman and
Hongjing Lu and
P. Jeffrey Brantingham
DBLP:conf/icwsm/PriniskiMHMLLB21.paperMotivationText: Recent research argues that moral discussions on social media are a catalyst for social change. This study sought to shed light on the moral dynamics shaping Black Lives Matter Twitter discussions by analyzing Tweets geo-located to Los Angeles.
DBLP:conf/icwsm/PriniskiMHMLLB21.paperContributionText: The development of computational techniques for mapping the structure of moral discourse on Twitter and an analysis of the connections between social media activism and protest.
DBLP:conf/icwsm/PriniskiMHMLLB21.paperResultsText: The study revealed that the most prominent moral concerns centered around discussions of (1) police authority and harm and (2) positive ingroup messaging.
